title: Sizing
fullText:
Battery chargers should be typically sized at the 10 h rate. Charging rates and voltages should be to manufacturer's recommendations.
The following Equation can be used to estimate the required size:
Ibc	=	0.1 Ã— C10	. . . 3.4.10.2
where
Ibc	=  maximum charge current of the battery charger, in amperes (A)
C10	=  10 h rate capacity of the battery, in ampere hours (Ah)
NOTE: This does not imply that the battery can be fully recharged in 10 hours.
